question.xref: DES s8, HC r187, HC r211
question.text: You are travelling behind a moped. You want to turn left just ahead. You should

explanation.text: Passing the moped and turning into the junction could mean that you cut across the front of the rider. This might force them to slow down, stop or even lose control. Slow down and stay behind the moped until it has passed the junction and you can then turn safely.

answer.text: overtake the moped before the junction
pull alongside the moped and stay level until just before the junction
sound your horn as a warning and pull in front of the moped
stay behind until the moped has passed the junction
